ipl::CFloatImage Class Reference

CFloatImage is a class derived from CGenericImage consisting of pixels with type FLOAT32, last updated 7/21/2002. More...

Detailed Description

CFloatImage is a class derived from CGenericImage consisting of pixels with type FLOAT32, last updated 7/21/2002.

Saving and loading images of this type has not yet been fully tested and documentation for the file format still need to be written. Though it should be possible to save and load and all bug reports are welcome!

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

See also:
CGenericImage
Version:
1.52, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ipl::CFloatImage::CFloatImage (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
FLOAT32    Color = 0
) 
 

Constructor for empty image, allocates memory.

All pixel values are initialised to 0. ROI is inactivated.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels.
Height  The height of image in pixels.
Color  Initial color value in all pixels. Defaults to 0. The function is faster when Color initializes to 0.

bool ipl::CFloatImage::Add (  CFloatImage &    Addend ) 
 

Calculates the sum of two CFloatImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Addend  is the image of class CFloatImage to be added
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty

bool ipl::CFloatImage::Copy (  COMPLEXCHOISE    mode,
CComplexImage &    Source
) 
 

Copies partially an image of class CComplex into this object.

ROI is inactivated. History from Source is copied to this image, old history in this image is deleted.

Parameters:
mode  Determines what part of the complex image is to be copied. The values are COMPLEX_REAL, COMPLEX_IMAGINARY, or COMPLEX_MODULUS.
Source  is the source image.
Returns :
False if the source image is empty.

bool ipl::CFloatImage::CopySubImage (  CFloatImage &    SourceImage,
int    xmin,
int    ymin,
int    xmax,
int    ymax
) 
 

Copies sourceImage of type CFloatImage to this image.

The values xmin, ymin, xmax and ymax) specifies the rectangle to be copied, uses integers because of origo offset. ROI is inactivated. If you want the resulting image placed in this image just use the same object for SourceImage. Note: In that case the method is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). Adds new line to history.

Parameters:
xmin  defines left side of rectangle in source image to copy from
ymin  defines top side of rectangle in source image to copy from
xmax  defines right side of rectangle in source image to copy from
ymax  defines buttom side of rectangle in source image to copy from
Returns :
false if outside image

Definition at line 358 of file float_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), TFloatImage::FileInfo, GetConstTFloatImagePtr(), m_History, m_Image, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, TFileInfo::PathAndFileName, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CFloatImage::CutOrZeroPad (  CFloatImage &    Source ) 
 

Copies a source image into 'this' object without scaling.

'This' object must be allocated. If the width/height of the source is larger than that of 'this' object, zero padding is applied. Simple cuts are applied for reduced width/height. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Source  is the spource image
Returns :
False if this image and/or the source image are empty

TFloatImage * ipl::CFloatImage::GetTFloatImagePtr (    ) 
 

To use the kernel C functions it is sometimes necessary to pass the TFloatImage structure which contents will be changed.

In other cases do not use this function to manipulate the image but use the methods in this class!

Returns :
pointer to a TFloatImage structure.

bool ipl::CFloatImage::Load (  const char *    pPathAndFileName )  [virtual]
 

Loads file of type given by extension from disk.

Adds new line to history. ROI is inactivated.

Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/doggie.bmp", relative "doggie.bmp". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path. There is no differense between upper and lower case characters, they are treated equally.
Returns :
false if load failed

Implements ipl::CGenericImage.

Calculates product of two images.

Parameters:

Definition at line 680 of file float_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetTFloatImagePtr(), m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

CFloatImage & ipl::CFloatImage::operator= (  const CFloatImage &    SourceImage ) 
 

Overloading of assignment operator.

All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, ROI and history. Previous data in this object are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty. Adds new line to history. An error is produced if both sides of the assignment operator is the same object.

Definition at line 54 of file float_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetConstTFloatImagePtr(), ipl::CText::GetItem(), GetOrigin(), TFloatImage::History, m_History, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROILowerRight, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIUpperLeft, TString::pChars, ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine(), ipl::CText::SetTextPtr(), and ipl::CText::TotalItems().

bool ipl::CFloatImage::SetROI (  const CPoint2D< INT32 > &    UL,
const CPoint2D< INT32 > &    LR
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets Region Of Interest (ROI) for this object.

If outside image dimensions false is returned and an error is produced. In that case the state of ROI is left unchanged. Image dimensions are the values returned from the methods GetMinX(), GetMaxX(), GetMinY() and GetMaxY(), i.e. it includes origo offset.

Parameters:
UL  Upper left value of ROI, relative to origo.
LR  Lower right value of ROI, relative to origo.
Returns :
False, if values are outside image dimensions, relative to origo.

Implements ipl::CGenericImage.

Definition at line 787 of file float_image.h.

References GetMaxX(), GetMaxY(), GetMinX(), GetMinY(), CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), TFloatImage::Height, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROILowerRight, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIUpperLeft, TFloatImage::Origo, TFloatImage::Width, T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.
